Fabric vs. Forge: Ensure that the DAVE mod is designed for Fabric, not Forge. Fabric and Forge mods are not interchangeable and require their respective mod loaders.​

Game Version Match: Confirm that the mod version matches your Minecraft version. For instance, a mod built for Minecraft 1.20.1 may not function correctly on 1.21.5.​

Dependencies: Some mods require additional libraries or APIs. Check the mod's documentation to see if it depends on other mods like Fabric API or specific libraries.​

🔍 2. Check Mod Menu Integration
Not all mods appear in the Mod Menu. The Mod Menu mod adds a "Mods" button to the main menu, allowing you to view and configure installed mods. However, some mods don't register themselves with Mod Menu and thus won't appear in the list. This doesn't necessarily mean they're not loaded. ​

package com.dave.mod;

import com.mojang.brigadier.CommandDispatcher;
import net.minecraft.server.command.CommandManager;
import net.minecraft.server.command.ServerCommandSource;
import net.minecraft.text.Text;
import net.fabricmc.api.ModInitializer;
import net.fabricmc.fabric.api.command.v2.CommandRegistrationCallback;

public class DaveCommand {

    public static void register() {
        CommandRegistrationCallback.EVENT.register((dispatcher, registryAccess, environment) -> {
            dispatcher.register(CommandManager.literal("dave")
                .executes(context -> {
                    context.getSource().sendFeedback(Text.literal("DAVE here! I'm working on something epic. Chill."), false);
                    return 1;
                }));
        });
    }
}

// Main mod class
public class DaveMod implements ModInitializer {
    public static final String MOD_ID = "davemod";

        StructureRegistry.register();

### 2. DAVE Entity Implementation

public class DaveEntity extends PathAwareEntity {
    // AI States
    private enum State { IDLE, HELPING, BUILDING, EXPLORING, GENERATING }
    
    private State currentState;
    private PlayerEntity currentPlayer;
    private BlockPos targetPosition;
    
    public DaveEntity(EntityType<? extends PathAwareEntity> type, World world) {
        super(type, world);
        this.currentState = State.IDLE;
    }
    
    @Override
    protected void initGoals() {
        this.goalSelector.add(1, new DaveFollowPlayerGoal(this));
        this.goalSelector.add(2, new DaveBuildStructureGoal(this));
        this.goalSelector.add(3, new DaveExploreGoal(this));
        // Add more goals as needed
    }
    
    // Custom methods for DAVE's functionality
    public void startHelpingPlayer(PlayerEntity player) {
        this.currentPlayer = player;
        this.currentState = State.HELPING;
    }
    
    public void generateRandomStructure() {
        this.currentState = State.GENERATING;
        // Structure generation logic
    }
}


### 3. Dialogue System

public class DaveDialogue {
    private static final Map<String, String[]> RESPONSES = Map.of(
        "help", new String[]{
            "Sure thing, buddy! What do you need?",
            "Dave's here to save the day! What's up?",
            "You need DAVE? DAVE needs you! How can I help?"
        },
        "build", new String[]{
            "Let me whip something up!",
            "Building is my middle name! Well, actually it's 'A', but still!",
            "Prepare to be amazed by my architectural skills!"
        }
    );
    
    public static String getResponse(String key) {
        String[] options = RESPONSES.get(key.toLowerCase());
        if (options == null || options.length == 0) {
            return "I'm not sure what you mean, friend.";
        }
        return options[new Random().nextInt(options.length)];
    }
}

public class DaveTaskSystem {
    private DaveEntity dave;
    private Queue<Task> taskQueue = new LinkedList<>();
    
    public DaveTaskSystem(DaveEntity dave) {
        this.dave = dave;
    }
    
    public void addTask(Task task) {
        taskQueue.add(task);
    }
    
    public void tick() {
        if (!taskQueue.isEmpty()) {
            Task current = taskQueue.peek();
            if (current.isComplete()) {
                taskQueue.remove();
            } else {
                current.execute(dave);
            }
        }
    }
}

public interface Task {
    void execute(DaveEntity dave);
    boolean isComplete();
}

public class MineOresTask implements Task {
    private BlockPos targetArea;
    private boolean complete;

    }
    
    @Override
    public boolean isComplete() {
        return complete;
    }
}

IllegalStateException: Failed to find system mod: minecraft

This means Forge is looking for the core minecraft mod (which it needs to run anything)... and it’s not finding it. So now let’s go into troubleshooting mode with Jedi precision.

🛠️ Step-by-Step Fix Guide
✅ 1. First: Don’t Panic. Renaming the file in File Explorer is okay...
But IntelliJ might not refresh automatically after that.

So let's force IntelliJ to recognize it:

In IntelliJ, go to File > Invalidate Caches / Restart...

Select "Invalidate and Restart"

This forces IntelliJ to pick up file changes and reload everything cleanly. That may already solve part of the issue if class path weirdness is the root.

✅ 2. Check Your Forge Setup: Did You Run genIntellijRuns?
You must run this command after setting up Forge. If you haven't already (or if something feels broken), do this:

Open the Terminal in IntelliJ (bottom panel), then run:
bash
Copy
Edit
./gradlew genIntellijRuns
(Use gradlew.bat on Windows like this:)

cmd
Copy
Edit
gradlew genIntellijRuns
This tells Forge:
🗣️ "Hey, set up all the run configs and system mods so we can actually launch Minecraft!"

Let that complete, then try runClient again.

✅ 3. Check build.gradle for Correct Minecraft Version
Open your build.gradle file and make sure it looks something like this:

groovy
Copy
Edit
minecraft {
    // Make sure this matches the version of Forge you installed
    mappings channel: 'official', version: '1.20.1'
    runs {
        client {
            workingDirectory project.file('run')
        }
    }
}
Also make sure you have this in your dependencies section:

groovy
Copy
Edit
dependencies {
    minecraft 'net.minecraftforge:forge:1.20.1-47.1.44' // or whatever Forge version you're using
}
⚠️ The key thing: make sure net.minecraftforge:forge:<version> is there and the version exists.

If this looks different, I can help you adjust it.

✅ 4. Force Re-download Dependencies
Sometimes Forge just forgets how to Forge. Help it out:

bash
Copy
Edit
gradlew --refresh-dependencies
✅ 5. Try Again
Now try runClient from the Gradle panel again:

Gradle > Tasks > fg_runs > runClient

🧩 What This Error Actually Means:
"Failed to find system mod: minecraft" = Forge can't find Minecraft in the dependencies it downloaded.

This almost always means one of these things:

🔧 Your build.gradle is missing the correct Forge + Minecraft dependency

📦 Forge didn’t finish downloading everything (corrupted cache, internet hiccup, etc.)

📁 Project structure isn’t set up right or runClient is misconfigured

✅ Step-by-Step Fix
☑️ 1. Show Me Your build.gradle

Switching between Java versions: Java 21 and Java 17 can co-exist on your system, and tools like IntelliJ can use the right version for each project. So, you can specify Java 17 for other applications while using Java 21 exclusively for the Minecraft mod.

For other Java-based projects, leave them set to Java 17 (or whatever version they need).

    // compileOnly "mezz.jei:jei-${mc_version}-forge-api:${jei_version}"

tasks.named('processResources', ProcessResources).configure {
    var replaceProperties = [

It seems there might be a misunderstanding or a problem with how you're trying to integrate Forge 1.21.5-50.0.4 with Maven. Forge is not typically directly packaged and distributed through Maven; it's intended to be installed and used as part of the Minecraft launcher or standalone. Here's a breakdown of why and how to use Forge:
Why Forge isn't typically used with Maven:
Forge is a mod loader:
Forge is essentially a framework that loads mods into Minecraft. It's not a library you include in your Maven project like other dependencies.
Minecraft-specific:
Forge is deeply integrated with Minecraft's internal structure, and it's installed within the Minecraft launcher or as a standalone.
Mod management:
Mods themselves are typically downloaded separately and placed into a dedicated "mods" folder within the Minecraft installation. 
How to use Forge (Correct Approach):
1. Download Forge:
Go to the official Forge website and find the appropriate version for Minecraft 1.21.5 (which includes 50.0.4 as a specific version). 
Download the Forge installer.
2. Install Forge:
Open the Forge installer.
Follow the instructions, selecting the Minecraft version you're using (1.21.5). 
Forge will install the necessary components within your Minecraft launcher profile or a new, standalone instance.
3. Download Mods:
Find mods compatible with Minecraft 1.21.5 and Forge.
Download the mods, which are usually in JAR format.
4. Install Mods:
Open your Minecraft launcher.
Select the Forge profile you created or the one you've configured for Forge.
Locate the "mods" folder within your Minecraft installation. This is usually inside your .minecraft folder (find it by pressing %appdata%, then .minecraft). 
Drag and drop the downloaded mod JAR files into the "mods" folder. 
5. Run Minecraft:
Launch Minecraft through the launcher with your Forge profile selected.
You should see the "Mods" button in the main menu where you can view and manage your installed mods. 
In Summary:
You don't need to use Maven to get Forge working. The correct approach is to install Forge through the Minecraft launcher and then add mods to the designated "mods" folder.

public class DaveTaskSystem {
    private DaveEntity dave;
    private Queue<Task> taskQueue = new LinkedList<>();
    
    public DaveTaskSystem(DaveEntity dave) {
        this.dave = dave;
    }
    
    public void addTask(Task task) {
        taskQueue.add(task);
    }
    
    public void tick() {
        if (!taskQueue.isEmpty()) {
            Task current = taskQueue.peek();
            if (current.isComplete()) {
                taskQueue.remove();
            } else {
                current.execute(dave);
            }
        }
    }
}

    boolean isComplete();

Ah! This is a classic issue with a few possible solutions. Let's tackle this systematically:

Why This Happens
When you see "found 1 non-Fabric mod" but it doesn't appear in the mods list, it typically means:

Mod is loading but not registering properly

Missing Fabric API dependency

Incorrect mod metadata

Mod file is in wrong location

Step-by-Step Fixes
1. Verify Mod Installation
Check your .minecraft/mods folder contains:

Your mod JAR (e.g., davemod-1.0.0.jar)

The required fabric-api-*.jar for 1.21.5

2. Check Logs Thoroughly
In .minecraft/logs/latest.log, search for:

plaintext
Copy
[FabricLoader] Loading mod davemod
If you see this but no errors, your mod is loading but not showing up.

3. Fix Common Causes
A. Missing @Mod Annotation (Forge-style)
Fabric doesn't use @Mod - ensure you're implementing ModInitializer:

java
Copy
public class DaveModMain implements ModInitializer {
    @Override
    public void onInitialize() {
        // Initialization code
    }
}
B. Incorrect Entrypoints
Your fabric.mod.json must point to EXACTLY this class:

json
Copy
"entrypoints": {
    "main": ["net.fabricmc.drvenrod.davemod.DaveModMain"]
}
C. Resource Loading Issue
Add this to build.gradle:

gradle
Copy
processResources {
    inputs.property "version", project.version
    filesMatching("fabric.mod.json") {
        expand "version": project.version
    }
}

package net.fabricmc.davemod;

import net.fabricmc.api.ModInitializer;
import net.fabricmc.davemod.command.dave_command;
import net.fabricmc.davemod.entity.DaveEntity;
import net.fabricmc.fabric.api.object.builder.v1.entity.FabricEntityTypeBuilder;
import net.fabricmc.fabric.api.object.builder.v1.entity.FabricDefaultAttributeRegistry;
import net.minecraft.entity.EntityDimensions;

import net.minecraft.entity.SpawnGroup;

import net.minecraft.registry.Registry;
import net.minecraft.registry.RegistryKey;
import net.minecraft.util.Identifier;
import org.slf4j.Logger;
import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;

public class dave implements ModInitializer {

    public static final String MOD_ID = "dave";

    public static final Logger LOGGER = LoggerFactory.getLogger(MOD_ID);

    // Create a registry key
    public static final RegistryKey<EntityType<DaveEntity>> DAVE_KEY =
        RegistryKey.of(Registries.ENTITY_TYPE.getKey(), new Identifier(MOD_ID, "dave"));

    // Register the actual entity using the registry key
    public static final EntityType<DaveEntity> DAVE = Registry.register(
        Registries.ENTITY_TYPE,
        DAVE_KEY.getValue(), // This gives us the Identifier object
        FabricEntityTypeBuilder.create(SpawnGroup.CREATURE, DaveEntity::new)
            .dimensions(EntityDimensions.fixed(0.75f, 0.75f))
            .build()
    );

    @Override
    public void onInitialize() {
        LOGGER.info("[dave] Ready to cause chaos! Mod is loading...");
        dave_command.register();

        FabricDefaultAttributeRegistry.register(DAVE, DaveEntity.createDaveAttributes());
    }
}

package net.fabricmc.davemod.entity;

import net.minecraft.entity.EntityType;
import net.minecraft.entity.attribute.DefaultAttributeContainer;
import net.minecraft.entity.attribute.EntityAttributes;
import net.minecraft.entity.mob.PathAwareEntity;
import net.minecraft.entity.mob.MobEntity;
import net.minecraft.entity.mob.MobEntityType;
import net.minecraft.entity.player.PlayerEntity;
import net.minecraft.entity.damage.DamageSource;
import net.minecraft.world.World;
import net.minecraft.util.math.Vec3d;

public class DaveEntity extends PathAwareEntity {

    public DaveEntity(EntityType<? extends PathAwareEntity> entityType, World world) {
        super(entityType, world);
    }

    // This method defines the attributes for the entity (health, speed, attack, etc.)
    public static DefaultAttributeContainer.Builder createDaveAttributes() {
        return PathAwareEntity.createMobAttributes()
            .add(EntityAttributes.GENERIC_MAX_HEALTH, 20.0D)
            .add(EntityAttributes.GENERIC_MOVEMENT_SPEED, 0.25D)
            .add(EntityAttributes.GENERIC_ATTACK_DAMAGE, 4.0D);
    }

    // Optional: Make Dave do something fun when hurt
    @Override
    public boolean damage(DamageSource source, float amount) {
        if (!this.world.isClient) {
            System.out.println("Dave: Ouch! That tickled.");
        }
        return super.damage(source, amount);
    }

    // Optional: Something when interacting (e.g., right-click)
    @Override
    public boolean interactMob(PlayerEntity player, net.minecraft.util.Hand hand) {
        if (!this.world.isClient) {
            player.sendMessage(net.minecraft.text.Text.of("DAVE: You rang?"), false);
        }
        return super.interactMob(player, hand);
    }
}

package net.fabricmc.davemod;

import net.fabricmc.api.ModInitializer;
import net.fabricmc.fabric.api.object.builder.v1.entity.FabricEntityTypeBuilder;
import net.fabricmc.fabric.api.object.builder.v1.entity.FabricDefaultAttributeRegistry;
import net.fabricmc.davemod.entity.DaveEntity;
import net.minecraft.entity.EntityDimensions;
import net.minecraft.entity.EntityType;
import net.minecraft.entity.SpawnGroup;
import net.minecraft.registry.Registries;
import net.minecraft.registry.Registry;
import net.minecraft.util.Identifier;

public class Dave implements ModInitializer {

    public static final String MOD_ID = "davemod";

    // Registering a unique ID for our entity type
    public static final Identifier DAVE_ID = new Identifier(MOD_ID, "dave");

    // Defining the EntityType for Dave
    public static final EntityType<DaveEntity> DAVE_ENTITY_TYPE = Registry.register(
        Registries.ENTITY_TYPE,
        DAVE_ID,
        FabricEntityTypeBuilder.create(SpawnGroup.CREATURE, DaveEntity::new)
            .dimensions(EntityDimensions.fixed(0.6f, 1.95f)) // Standard player-sized hitbox
            .trackRangeBlocks(80)
            .trackedUpdateRate(3)
            .build()
    );

    @Override
    public void onInitialize() {
        // Register the entity's attributes (like health and speed)
        FabricDefaultAttributeRegistry.register(DAVE_ENTITY_TYPE, DaveEntity.createDaveAttributes());

        System.out.println("Dave Mod initialized. Time to cause some creative chaos!");
    }
}

public class DaveTaskSystem {
    private DaveEntity dave;
    private Queue<Task> taskQueue = new LinkedList<>();
    
    public DaveTaskSystem(DaveEntity dave) {
        this.dave = dave;
    }
    
    public void addTask(Task task) {
        taskQueue.add(task);
    }
    
    public void tick() {
        if (!taskQueue.isEmpty()) {
            Task current = taskQueue.peek();
            if (current.isComplete()) {
                taskQueue.remove();
            } else {
                current.execute(dave);
            }
        }
    }
}

package net.fabricmc.davemod.entity;

import net.minecraft.entity.EntityType;
import net.minecraft.entity.attribute.DefaultAttributeContainer;
import net.minecraft.entity.attribute.EntityAttributes;
import net.minecraft.entity.mob.PathAwareEntity;
import net.minecraft.world.World;

public class DaveEntity extends PathAwareEntity {
    
    public DaveEntity(EntityType<? extends PathAwareEntity> entityType, World world) {
        super(entityType, world);
    }

    public static DefaultAttributeContainer.Builder createDaveAttributes() {
        return PathAwareEntity.createMobAttributes()
            .add(EntityAttributes.GENERIC_MAX_HEALTH, 20.0)
            .add(EntityAttributes.GENERIC_MOVEMENT_SPEED, 0.25);
    }
}

                    }));
        });
    }

package net.fabricmc.davemod.mixin;

import net.minecraft.server.MinecraftServer;
import net.fabricmc.davemod.dave;
import org.spongepowered.asm.mixin.Mixin;
import org.spongepowered.asm.mixin.injection.At;
import org.spongepowered.asm.mixin.injection.Inject;
import org.spongepowered.asm.mixin.injection.callback.CallbackInfo;

@Mixin(MinecraftServer.class)
public class dave_mixin {
	@Inject(at = @At("HEAD"), method = "loadWorld")
	private void onLoadWorld(CallbackInfo info) {
		DAVE.LOGGER.info("[DAVE] The server is loading the world.");
		// Additional actions or modifications can be added here
	}
}

public class DaveTaskSystem {
    private DaveEntity dave;
    private Queue<Task> taskQueue = new LinkedList<>();
    
    public DaveTaskSystem(DaveEntity dave) {
        this.dave = dave;
    }
    
    public void addTask(Task task) {
        taskQueue.add(task);
    }
    
    public void tick() {
        if (!taskQueue.isEmpty()) {
            Task current = taskQueue.peek();
            if (current.isComplete()) {
                taskQueue.remove();
            } else {
                current.execute(dave);
            }
        }
    }
}

public interface Task {
    void execute(DaveEntity dave);
    boolean isComplete();
}

	}
}

1. Fixing EntityAttributes in DaveEntity.java
In Fabric 1.21.5, the attribute system for entities has been updated. The constants for generic attributes (GENERIC_MAX_HEALTH, GENERIC_MOVEMENT_SPEED) are no longer found directly under EntityAttributes. Instead, they are part of a more structured system.

Here's how to fix it:

package net.fabricmc.davemod.entity;

import net.minecraft.entity.EntityType;
import net.minecraft.entity.attribute.DefaultAttributeContainer;
import net.minecraft.entity.attribute.EntityAttributes;
import net.minecraft.entity.mob.PathAwareEntity;
import net.minecraft.world.World;

public class DaveEntity extends PathAwareEntity {

    public DaveEntity(EntityType<? extends PathAwareEntity> entityType, World world) {
        super(entityType, world);
    }

    // Updated attributes
    public static DefaultAttributeContainer.Builder createDaveAttributes() {
        return PathAwareEntity.createMobAttributes()
            .add(EntityAttributes.GENERIC_MAX_HEALTH, 20.0D)  // Corrected attribute definition
            .add(EntityAttributes.GENERIC_MOVEMENT_SPEED, 0.25D);  // Corrected attribute definition
    }
}
Explanation:
createDaveAttributes() method: This method builds the attribute container, using PathAwareEntity.createMobAttributes(), which is a static helper method for path-aware entities (like mobs). Then, the attributes are added using the correct constants from EntityAttributes.

GENERIC_MAX_HEALTH and GENERIC_MOVEMENT_SPEED are now accessed directly from EntityAttributes as per the updated API.

To fix this, you'll need to pass the appropriate RegistryKey when building your EntityType. Here's how to fix it:

Step-by-Step Fix
Locate the build method call: Find where you're calling .build() in the ModEntities.java file.

Summary:
Make sure you are passing the correct registry key when calling .build() on your FabricEntityTypeBuilder. The registry key is necessary to link your entity type to the Minecraft registry system.

ChatGPT said:
It seems like you're facing a mixin-related error due to a missing mixin file (DaveMixin.java) or misconfiguration in the dave.mixins.json. This is a common issue when setting up mixins, and here’s how you can resolve it:

Step-by-Step Fix for Mixin Issue:
1. Verify Mixin Class File Exists
Ensure that you have the DaveMixin.java file in the correct location:

File Path: src/main/java/net/fabricmc/davemod/mixin/DaveMixin.java

Case Sensitivity: Ensure the file name and path are case-sensitive; check if it’s spelled exactly as DaveMixin.java.

2. Check Your dave.mixins.json File
The dave.mixins.json should be in the resources/mixin folder and should look something like this:

json
Copy
Edit
{
  "required": true,
  "minVersion": "0.8",
  "package": "net.fabricmc.davemod.mixin",
  "mixins": [
    "DaveMixin"
  ],
  "client": [
    "DaveClientMixin"  // Add any client-specific mixins here
  ],
  "server": []
}
This file tells the mixin processor which classes to inject into Minecraft. In the above example, it's looking for DaveMixin in the net.fabricmc.davemod.mixin package.

3. Correctly Define Mixin Class
If you don’t already have it, you’ll need to create a class for your mixin. For example:

java
Copy
Edit
package net.fabricmc.davemod.mixin;

import net.minecraft.client.MinecraftClient;
import org.spongepowered.asm.mixin.Mixin;
import org.spongepowered.asm.mixin.gen.Invoker;

@Mixin(MinecraftClient.class)
public class DaveMixin {
    @Invoker("doSomethingSpecial")
    public void invokeDoSomethingSpecial() {
        // Your custom behavior here
    }
}
Make sure your mixin is targeting the right Minecraft class (like MinecraftClient in the above example), and the methods are being injected or altered as needed.

4. Disable Mixins Temporarily
To verify that the issue is specifically with the mixin configuration, comment out the mixin entry in fabric.mod.json temporarily:

json
Copy
Edit
{
  "mixins": [
    // "mixin/dave.mixins.json"
  ]
}
Then, run the game using the command:

bash
Copy
Edit
gradlew clean runClient
If the game launches successfully, it confirms that the mixins are the issue.

5. Re-enable and Test Mixins
Once you have verified the mixins are causing the problem, ensure that everything is correctly configured and the file paths are accurate. Re-enable the mixin and try running the client again.

6. Debugging the Mixin
If you’re still having issues after checking the mixin setup, you can add debugging to your mixin code to confirm that the classes and methods are correctly getting injected.

For example, in your DaveMixin.java:

java
Copy
Edit
package net.fabricmc.davemod.mixin;

import net.minecraft.client.MinecraftClient;
import org.spongepowered.asm.mixin.Mixin;
import org.spongepowered.asm.mixin.gen.Invoker;

@Mixin(MinecraftClient.class)
public class DaveMixin {
    @Invoker("doSomethingSpecial")
    public void invokeDoSomethingSpecial() {
        System.out.println("Mixin applied successfully!");
    }
}
This will help you see in the console logs whether the mixin is getting applied correctly.

Additional Tips:
Ensure You Have Fabric API in the Mods Folder: Double-check that fabric-api and your mod's .jar file are in the correct folder (.minecraft/mods/).

Use Fabric Development Environment: Running from IntelliJ using gradlew runClient is the ideal method during development. It will automatically reload code changes and display real-time logs.

Final Thoughts
Once the mixin issue is resolved, your mod should load correctly and you can start testing its functionality within Minecraft. Let me know if you need more help with this or any other part of the development process!

package net.fabricmc.davemod.entity;

import net.minecraft.entity.EntityType;
import net.minecraft.entity.ai.goal.*;
import net.minecraft.entity.attribute.DefaultAttributeContainer;
import net.minecraft.entity.attribute.EntityAttributes;
import net.minecraft.entity.mob.PathAwareEntity;
import net.minecraft.entity.player.PlayerEntity;
import net.minecraft.item.Items;
import net.minecraft.particle.ParticleTypes;
import net.minecraft.util.ActionResult;
import net.minecraft.util.Hand;
import net.minecraft.world.World;

public class DaveEntity extends PathAwareEntity {

    public DaveEntity(EntityType<? extends PathAwareEntity> entityType, World world) {
        super(entityType, world);
    }

    public static DefaultAttributeContainer.Builder createDaveAttributes() {
        return PathAwareEntity.createMobAttributes()
                .add(EntityAttributes.MAX_HEALTH, 20.0)
                .add(EntityAttributes.MOVEMENT_SPEED, 0.25)
                .add(EntityAttributes.FOLLOW_RANGE, 16.0);
    }

    @Override
    protected void initGoals() {
        // Basic AI
        this.goalSelector.add(1, new SwimGoal(this));
        this.goalSelector.add(2, new WanderAroundGoal(this, 0.8));
        this.goalSelector.add(3, new LookAtEntityGoal(this, PlayerEntity.class, 8.0F));
        this.goalSelector.add(4, new LookAroundGoal(this));
        
        // Follow players holding diamonds
        this.goalSelector.add(5, new TemptGoal(this, 1.2, Ingredient.ofItems(Items.DIAMOND), false));
    }

    @Override
    public ActionResult interactMob(PlayerEntity player, Hand hand) {
        if (!this.world.isClient()) {
            player.sendMessage(Text.literal("DAVE: Need help with building?"), false);
            this.world.addParticle(ParticleTypes.HEART, this.getX(), this.getY() + 1, this.getZ(), 0, 0.1, 0);
        }
        return ActionResult.SUCCESS;
    }
}

package net.fabricmc.davemod.command;

import com.mojang.brigadier.CommandDispatcher;
import net.minecraft.server.command.CommandManager;
import net.minecraft.server.command.ServerCommandSource;
import net.minecraft.server.world.ServerWorld;
import net.minecraft.text.Text;
import net.minecraft.util.math.Vec3d;
import net.fabricmc.fabric.api.command.v2.CommandRegistrationCallback;
import net.fabricmc.davemod.entity.ModEntities;

public class DaveCommand {
    public static void register() {
        CommandRegistrationCallback.EVENT.register((dispatcher, registryAccess, environment) -> {
            dispatcher.register(CommandManager.literal("dave")
                .executes(context -> {
                    ServerCommandSource source = context.getSource();
                    ServerWorld world = source.getWorld();
                    Vec3d pos = source.getPosition();
                    
                    // Spawn DAVE
                    var dave = ModEntities.DAVE.create(world);
                    if (dave != null) {
                        dave.refreshPositionAndAngles(pos.x, pos.y, pos.z, 0, 0);
                        world.spawnEntity(dave);
                        
                        // Visual feedback
                        world.addParticle(
                            ParticleTypes.HAPPY_VILLAGER,
                            pos.x, pos.y + 1, pos.z,
                            0, 0.5, 0
                        );
                        
                        source.sendFeedback(() -> 
                            Text.literal("DAVE has arrived!"), 
                            false
                        );
                    }
                    return 1;
                })
            );
        });
    }
}

package net.fabricmc.davemod;

import org.slf4j.Logger;

    public static final String MOD_ID = "davemod";
    public static final Logger LOGGER = LoggerFactory.getLogger(MOD_ID);

    @Override
    public void onInitialize() {
        // Register everything
        DaveCommand.register();
        ModEntities.registerModEntities();
        
        LOGGER.info("DAVE is ready to help!");
    }
}

package net.fabricmc.davemod.entity;

import net.minecraft.entity.EntityType;
import net.minecraft.entity.attribute.DefaultAttributeContainer;
import net.minecraft.entity.attribute.EntityAttributes;
import net.minecraft.entity.mob.MobEntity;
import net.minecraft.entity.mob.MobEntityWithAi;
import net.minecraft.world.World;
import net.fabricmc.davemod.Dave;

public class DaveEntity extends MobEntityWithAi {  // Assuming DaveEntity extends MobEntity or its subclass
    public DaveEntity(EntityType<? extends MobEntity> entityType, World world) {
        super(entityType, world);
    }

    // Override this method to define the attributes of DAVE
    public static DefaultAttributeContainer.Builder createMobAttributes() {
        return MobEntity.createMobAttributes()
            .add(EntityAttributes.GENERIC_MAX_HEALTH, 20.0)  // Health
            .add(EntityAttributes.GENERIC_MOVEMENT_SPEED, 0.25); // Movement speed
    }

    @Override
    protected void initAttributes() {
        super.initAttributes();
        this.getAttributeInstance(EntityAttributes.GENERIC_MAX_HEALTH).setBaseValue(20.0);
        this.getAttributeInstance(EntityAttributes.GENERIC_MOVEMENT_SPEED).setBaseValue(0.25);
    }
}

import net.minecraft.server.command.ServerCommandSource;
import net.minecraft.server.command.CommandManager;
import net.minecraft.server.world.ServerWorld;
import net.minecraft.text.Text;
import net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos;
import net.minecraft.util.math.Vec3d;
import net.minecraft.particle.ParticleTypes;
import net.minecraft.entity.SpawnReason;
import net.fabricmc.fabric.api.command.v2.CommandRegistrationCallback;
import net.fabricmc.davemod.entity.ModEntities;

public class DaveCommand {
    public static void register() {
        CommandRegistrationCallback.EVENT.register((dispatcher, registryAccess, environment) -> {
            dispatcher.register(CommandManager.literal("dave")
                    .executes(context -> {
                        ServerCommandSource source = context.getSource();
                        ServerWorld world = source.getWorld();
                        Vec3d pos = source.getPosition();
                        BlockPos blockPos = BlockPos.ofFloored(pos);

                        try {
                            var dave = ModEntities.DAVE.spawn(
                                    world,
                                    blockPos,
                                    SpawnReason.COMMAND
                            );

                            if (dave != null) {
                                world.spawnParticles(
                                        ParticleTypes.HAPPY_VILLAGER,
                                        pos.x, pos.y + 1, pos.z,
                                        5,
                                        0.5, 0.5, 0.5,
                                        0.1
                                );

                                source.sendFeedback(() ->
                                                Text.literal("DAVE has arrived!"),
                                        false
                                );
                                return 1;
                            }
                        } catch (Exception e) {
                            source.sendError(Text.literal("Failed to spawn DAVE: " + e.getMessage()));
                        }
                        return 0;
                    })
            );
        });
    }
}   :::   (DaveEntity.java)-: package net.fabricmc.davemod.entity;

import net.minecraft.entity.EntityType;
import net.minecraft.entity.ai.goal.*;
import net.minecraft.entity.attribute.DefaultAttributeContainer;
import net.minecraft.entity.attribute.EntityAttributes;
import net.minecraft.entity.mob.PathAwareEntity;
import net.minecraft.entity.player.PlayerEntity;
import net.minecraft.item.Items;
import net.minecraft.recipe.Ingredient;
import net.minecraft.server.world.ServerWorld;
import net.minecraft.particle.ParticleTypes;
import net.minecraft.util.ActionResult;
import net.minecraft.util.Hand;
import net.minecraft.text.Text;
import net.minecraft.world.World;

public class DaveEntity extends PathAwareEntity {

    public DaveEntity(EntityType<? extends PathAwareEntity> entityType, World world) {
        super(entityType, world);
    }

    public static DefaultAttributeContainer.Builder createDaveAttributes() {
        return PathAwareEntity.createMobAttributes()
                .add(EntityAttributes.MAX_HEALTH, 20.0)
                .add(EntityAttributes.MOVEMENT_SPEED, 0.25)
                .add(EntityAttributes.FOLLOW_RANGE, 16.0);
    }

    @Override
    protected void initGoals() {
        this.goalSelector.add(1, new SwimGoal(this));
        this.goalSelector.add(2, new WanderAroundGoal(this, 0.8));
        this.goalSelector.add(3, new LookAtEntityGoal(this, PlayerEntity.class, 8.0F));
        this.goalSelector.add(4, new LookAroundGoal(this));
        this.goalSelector.add(5, new TemptGoal(this, 1.2, Ingredient.ofItems(Items.DIAMOND), false));
    }

    @Override
    public ActionResult interactMob(PlayerEntity player, Hand hand) {
        if (!this.getWorld().isClient()) {
            player.sendMessage(Text.literal("DAVE: Need help with building?"), false);
            if (this.getWorld() instanceof ServerWorld serverWorld) {
                serverWorld.spawnParticles(
                        ParticleTypes.HEART,
                        this.getX(), this.getY() + 1, this.getZ(),
                        3,
                        0.3, 0.3, 0.3,
                        0.1
                );

            }
        }
        return ActionResult.SUCCESS;
    }

package com.yourpackage.davemod;

import net.fabricmc.api.ClientModInitializer;
import net.fabricmc.fabric.api.client.rendering.v1.EntityRendererRegistry;

public class DaveModClient implements ClientModInitializer {
    @Override
    public void onInitializeClient() {
        EntityRendererRegistry.register(DaveMod.DAVE_ENTITY_TYPE, DaveRenderer::new);
    }
}

},
If the client-side entrypoint is missing, Minecraft won’t register your renderer = crash city.

package net.fabricmc.davemod;

import net.fabricmc.api.ClientModInitializer;
import net.fabricmc.fabric.api.client.rendering.v1.EntityRendererRegistry;
import net.minecraft.client.render.entity.MobEntityRenderer;
import net.minecraft.client.render.entity.model.BipedEntityModel;
import net.minecraft.client.render.entity.model.EntityModelLayers;
import net.minecraft.util.Identifier;

import net.fabricmc.davemod.entity.DaveEntity;

public class DaveModClient implements ClientModInitializer {
    @Override
    public void onInitializeClient() {
        EntityRendererRegistry.register(ModEntities.DAVE, (context) -> {
            return new MobEntityRenderer<>(
                context,
                new BipedEntityModel<>(context.getPart(EntityModelLayers.PLAYER), false),
                0.5f
            ) {
                @Override
                public Identifier getTexture(DaveEntity entity) {
                    return new Identifier("davemod", "textures/entity/daveskin.png");
                }
            };
        });
    }
}

package net.fabricmc.davemod.entity.client;

import net.fabricmc.davemod.entity.custom.DaveEntity;
import net.minecraft.client.render.entity.EntityRendererFactory;
import net.minecraft.client.render.entity.MobEntityRenderer;
import net.minecraft.client.render.entity.model.BipedEntityModel;
import net.minecraft.client.render.entity.model.EntityModelLayers;
import net.minecraft.util.Identifier;

public class DaveEntityRenderer extends MobEntityRenderer<DaveEntity, BipedEntityModel<DaveEntity>> {
    public DaveEntityRenderer(EntityRendererFactory.Context context) {
        super(context, new BipedEntityModel<>(context.getModelLoader().getModelPart(EntityModelLayers.PLAYER)), 0.5f);
    }

    @Override
    public Identifier getTexture(DaveEntity entity) {
        return new Identifier("davemod", "textures/entity/daveskin.png");
    }
}

import net.fabricmc.api.ClientModInitializer;
import net.fabricmc.davemod.entity.ModEntities;

import net.minecraft.client.render.entity.EntityRendererRegistry;

public class DaveModClient implements ClientModInitializer {
    @Override
    public void onInitializeClient() {
        EntityRendererRegistry.register(ModEntities.DAVE, DaveEntityRenderer::new);
    }
}

package net.fabricmc.davemod.entity;

import net.minecraft.entity.EntityType;
import net.minecraft.entity.ai.goal.*;
import net.minecraft.entity.attribute.DefaultAttributeContainer;
import net.minecraft.entity.attribute.EntityAttributes;
import net.minecraft.entity.mob.PathAwareEntity;
import net.minecraft.entity.player.PlayerEntity;
import net.minecraft.item.Items;
import net.minecraft.recipe.Ingredient;
import net.minecraft.server.world.ServerWorld;
import net.minecraft.particle.ParticleTypes;
import net.minecraft.util.ActionResult;
import net.minecraft.util.Hand;
import net.minecraft.text.Text;
import net.minecraft.world.World;

public class DaveEntity extends PathAwareEntity {

    public DaveEntity(EntityType<? extends PathAwareEntity> entityType, World world) {
        super(entityType, world);
    }

    public static DefaultAttributeContainer.Builder createDaveAttributes() {
        return PathAwareEntity.createMobAttributes()
                .add(EntityAttributes.GENERIC_MAX_HEALTH, 20.0)
                .add(EntityAttributes.GENERIC_MOVEMENT_SPEED, 0.25)
                .add(EntityAttributes.GENERIC_FOLLOW_RANGE, 16.0);
    }

    @Override
    protected void initGoals() {
        this.goalSelector.add(1, new SwimGoal(this));
        this.goalSelector.add(2, new WanderAroundGoal(this, 0.8));
        this.goalSelector.add(3, new LookAtEntityGoal(this, PlayerEntity.class, 8.0F));
        this.goalSelector.add(4, new LookAroundGoal(this));
        this.goalSelector.add(5, new TemptGoal(this, 1.2, Ingredient.ofItems(Items.DIAMOND), false));
    }

    @Override
    public ActionResult interactMob(PlayerEntity player, Hand hand) {
        if (!this.getWorld().isClient()) {
            player.sendMessage(Text.literal("DAVE: Need help with building?"), false);
            if (this.getWorld() instanceof ServerWorld serverWorld) {
                serverWorld.spawnParticles(
                        ParticleTypes.HEART,
                        this.getX(), this.getY() + 1, this.getZ(),
                        3,
                        0.3, 0.3, 0.3,
                        0.1
                );
            }
        }
        return ActionResult.SUCCESS;
    }
}
4. DaveCommand.java (Command Implementation)
java
package net.fabricmc.davemod.command;

import net.minecraft.server.command.ServerCommandSource;
import net.minecraft.server.command.CommandManager;
import net.minecraft.server.world.ServerWorld;
import net.minecraft.text.Text;
import net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos;
import net.minecraft.util.math.Vec3d;
import net.minecraft.particle.ParticleTypes;
import net.minecraft.entity.SpawnReason;
import net.fabricmc.fabric.api.command.v2.CommandRegistrationCallback;
import net.fabricmc.davemod.entity.ModEntities;
import net.fabricmc.davemod.Dave;

public class DaveCommand {
    public static void register() {
        CommandRegistrationCallback.EVENT.register((dispatcher, registryAccess, environment) -> {
            dispatcher.register(CommandManager.literal("dave")
                    .executes(context -> {
                        ServerCommandSource source = context.getSource();
                        ServerWorld world = source.getWorld();
                        Vec3d pos = source.getPosition();
                        BlockPos blockPos = BlockPos.ofFloored(pos);

                        try {
                            if (ModEntities.DAVE == null) {
                                throw new IllegalStateException("DAVE entity type not registered");
                            }
                            
                            var dave = ModEntities.DAVE.spawn(
                                    world,
                                    blockPos,
                                    SpawnReason.COMMAND
                            );

                            if (dave != null) {
                                world.spawnParticles(
                                        ParticleTypes.HAPPY_VILLAGER,
                                        pos.x, pos.y + 1, pos.z,
                                        5,
                                        0.5, 0.5, 0.5,
                                        0.1
                                );

                                source.sendFeedback(() ->
                                                Text.literal("DAVE has arrived!"),
                                        false
                                );
                                return 1;
                            } else {
                                throw new IllegalStateException("Spawn returned null");
                            }
                        } catch (Exception e) {
                            source.sendError(Text.literal("Failed to spawn DAVE: " + e.getMessage()));
                            Dave.LOGGER.error("Failed to spawn DAVE", e);
                            return 0;
                        }
                    })
            );
        });
    }
}

package net.fabricmc.davemod.entity.client;

import net.fabricmc.davemod.DaveMod;
import net.fabricmc.davemod.entity.custom.DaveEntity;
import net.minecraft.client.render.entity.EntityRendererFactory;
import net.minecraft.client.render.entity.MobEntityRenderer;
import net.minecraft.client.render.entity.model.BipedEntityModel;
import net.minecraft.client.render.entity.model.EntityModelLayers;
import net.minecraft.util.Identifier;

public class DaveEntityRenderer extends MobEntityRenderer<DaveEntity, BipedEntityModel<DaveEntity>> {
    private static final Identifier TEXTURE = new Identifier(DaveMod.MOD_ID, "textures/entity/daveskin.png");

    public DaveEntityRenderer(EntityRendererFactory.Context context) {
        super(context, new BipedEntityModel<>(context.getPart(EntityModelLayers.PLAYER)), 0.5f);
    }

    @Override
    public Identifier getTextureLocation(DaveEntity entity) {
        return TEXTURE;
    }
}

package net.fabricmc.davemod.command;

import net.fabricmc.fabric.api.command.v2.CommandRegistrationCallback;
import net.fabricmc.davemod.entity.ModEntities;
import net.minecraft.command.CommandRegistryAccess;
import net.minecraft.entity.SpawnReason;
import net.minecraft.server.command.CommandManager;
import net.minecraft.server.command.ServerCommandSource;
import net.minecraft.server.world.ServerWorld;
import net.minecraft.text.Text;
import net.minecraft.particle.ParticleTypes;
import net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos;
import net.minecraft.util.math.Vec3d;

public class DaveCommand {
    public static void register() {
        CommandRegistrationCallback.EVENT.register((dispatcher, registryAccess, environment) -> {
            dispatcher.register(CommandManager.literal("dave")
                .executes(context -> {
                    ServerCommandSource source = context.getSource();
                    ServerWorld world = source.getWorld();
                    Vec3d pos = source.getPosition();
                    BlockPos blockPos = new BlockPos((int) pos.x, (int) pos.y, (int) pos.z); // ✅ Corrected

                    try {
                        var dave = ModEntities.DAVE.spawn(
                            world,
                            blockPos,
                            SpawnReason.COMMAND
                        );

                        if (dave != null) {
                            world.spawnParticles(
                                ParticleTypes.HAPPY_VILLAGER,
                                pos.x, pos.y + 1, pos.z,
                                5,
                                0.5, 0.5, 0.5,
                                0.1
                            );

                            source.sendFeedback(() ->
                                    Text.literal("DAVE has arrived!"),
                                false
                            );
                            return 1;
                        }
                    } catch (Exception e) {
                        source.sendError(Text.literal("Failed to spawn DAVE: " + e.getMessage()));
                    }
                    return 0;
                })
            );
        });
    }
}

powershell
Copy

$basePath = "C:\Users\NickK\Desktop\DAVE-Mod\src\main\java"

# Define target folders
$folders = @(
    "net\mindbuild\davemod",
    "net\mindbuild\davemod\client",
    "net\mindbuild\davemod\entity\custom"
)

# Create folders if they don’t exist
foreach ($folder in $folders) {
    $fullPath = Join-Path $basePath $folder
    if (-not (Test-Path $fullPath)) {
        New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $fullPath | Out-Null
    }
}

# Move files
$moveMap = @{
    "DaveMod.java" = "net\mindbuild\davemod"
    "DaveCommand.java" = "net\mindbuild\davemod"
    "ModEntities.java" = "net\mindbuild\davemod"
    "ModEntityRenderer.java" = "net\mindbuild\davemod"
    "ModMessages.java" = "net\mindbuild\davemod"
    "ModLootTables.java" = "net\mindbuild\davemod"
    "DaveModClient.java" = "net\mindbuild\davemod\client"
    "DaveRenderer.java" = "net\mindbuild\davemod\client"
    "DaveModel.java" = "net\mindbuild\davemod\client"
    "DaveEntity.java" = "net\mindbuild\davemod\entity\custom"
}

foreach ($file in $moveMap.Keys) {
    $target = Join-Path $basePath $moveMap[$file]
    $found = Get-ChildItem -Path $basePath -Recurse -Filter $file -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
    if ($found) {
        Move-Item -Path $found.FullName -Destination $target -Force
        Write-Host "Moved: $file -> $target"
    } else {
        Write-Host "❌ Not found: $file"
    }
}

package net.mindbuild.davemod.client.renderer;

import net.mindbuild.davemod.entity.custom.DaveEntity;

import net.minecraft.client.render.entity.MobEntityRenderer;
import net.minecraft.util.Identifier;
import net.minecraft.client.render.entity.model.EntityModelLayers;
import net.minecraft.client.render.entity.model.BipedEntityModel;

public class DaveRenderer extends MobEntityRenderer<DaveEntity, BipedEntityModel<DaveEntity>> {

    public DaveRenderer(EntityRendererFactory.Context context) {
        super(context, new DaveModel(context.getPart(EntityModelLayers.PLAYER)), 0.5f);
    }

    @Override
    public Identifier getTexture(DaveEntity entity) {
        return new Identifier("davemod", "textures/entity/dave.png");
    }
}

package net.mindbuild.davemod.command;

import com.mojang.brigadier.CommandDispatcher;
import net.fabricmc.fabric.api.command.v2.CommandRegistrationCallback;
import net.minecraft.server.command.CommandManager;
import net.minecraft.server.command.ServerCommandSource;
import net.minecraft.server.command.CommandRegistryAccess;

public class DaveCommand {
    public static void register() {
        CommandRegistrationCallback.EVENT.register((CommandDispatcher<ServerCommandSource> dispatcher, CommandRegistryAccess registryAccess, CommandManager.RegistrationEnvironment environment) -> {
            // Example dummy command
            dispatcher.register(CommandManager.literal("dave")
                .executes(context -> {
                    context.getSource().sendFeedback(() -> Text.literal("Hi, I'm Dave!"), false);
                    return 1;
                })
            );
        });
    }
}

✅ Step-by-Step: How to Update Fabric API
🔍 Step 1: Check the Target Minecraft Version
Go to the official Fabric API download page:

👉 https://modmuss50.me/fabric.html

ChatGPT said:
Ah, the classic "missing Minecraft client packages" error. Don’t worry—this is a super common roadblock, and we’re gonna karate-kick it out of the way together. 🥋👊

💥 What’s Happening?
Your DaveModel and DaveRenderer classes are trying to import client-side rendering/model classes, but those classes don’t exist in the main source set by default in Fabric mods.

By default, your mod only compiles and sees the common/server-side code. But anything inside net.minecraft.client lives in the client-side namespace, and Fabric isolates that so it doesn’t accidentally compile on a headless server.

🛠️ How to Fix It
We need to:

✅ 1. Move your DaveModel.java and DaveRenderer.java to a client source set
Fabric requires all client-only code (like rendering or models) to be in a separate client source folder. Here's what to do:

📁 Folder Structure Fix:
In your project at:

swift
Copy
Edit
DAVE-Mod/src/main/java/net/mindbuild/davemod/client/renderer
DAVE-Mod/src/main/java/net/mindbuild/davemod/client/model
Move these to the client source set:

swift
Copy
Edit
DAVE-Mod/src/client/java/net/mindbuild/davemod/client/renderer
DAVE-Mod/src/client/java/net/mindbuild/davemod/client/model
(If /src/client/java/ doesn't exist, create it.)

🧪 2. Tell Gradle to recognize the client source set
Open your build.gradle file and add this snippet at the bottom after all plugin/config blocks:

groovy
Copy
Edit
sourceSets {
    client {
        java {
            srcDirs = ["src/client/java"]
        }
        compileClasspath += main.compileClasspath
        runtimeClasspath += main.runtimeClasspath
    }
}

loom {
    splitEnvironmentSourceSets = true
}
This tells Fabric Loom to treat the client code separately, but still lets it access shared classes like DaveEntity.

♻️ 3. Rebuild!
Now run:

bash
Copy
Edit
./gradlew clean build
If all's right in the Minecraftverse, those scary red error fangs should disappear like a creeper in sunlight. 🌞💨

Ah yes — this is a classic "Client-side code not recognized" problem. What’s happening is your renderer and model classes are using client-only packages (net.minecraft.client.*), but your build script isn't properly separating or compiling the client source set, or more importantly — not telling the main build process to use the right client Minecraft libraries.

Let’s fix that properly. Below is the updated and corrected build.gradle that resolves your issue:

✅ REPLACEMENT build.gradle FILE (Fabric Loom 1.10+, Minecraft 1.21.5-compatible)
groovy
Copy
Edit
plugins {
	id 'fabric-loom' version '1.10-SNAPSHOT'
	id 'maven-publish'
}

version = project.mod_version
group = project.maven_group

base {
	archivesName = project.archives_base_name
}

repositories {
	mavenCentral()
	maven { url 'https://maven.fabricmc.net' } // Required for Fabric API
}

loom {
	splitEnvironmentSourceSets() // Splits 'client' and 'main'

	mods {
		davemod {
			sourceSet sourceSets.main
			sourceSet sourceSets.client
		}
	}
}

dependencies {
	// Minecraft and Yarn mappings
	minecraft "com.mojang:minecraft:${project.minecraft_version}"
	mappings "net.fabricmc:yarn:${project.yarn_mappings}:v2"

	// Fabric loader and API
	modImplementation "net.fabricmc:fabric-loader:${project.loader_version}"
	modImplementation "net.fabricmc.fabric-api:fabric-api:${project.fabric_version}"

	// This ensures client-only code compiles correctly
	modImplementation sourceSets.client.output
}

sourceSets {
	client {
		java {
			srcDirs = ["src/client/java"]
		}
		compileClasspath += sourceSets.main.output
		runtimeClasspath += sourceSets.main.output
	}
}

processResources {
	inputs.property "version", project.version
	duplicatesStrategy = DuplicatesStrategy.EXCLUDE

	filesMatching("fabric.mod.json") {
		expand "version": project.version
	}
}

tasks.withType(JavaCompile).configureEach {
	options.release = 21
}

java {
	withSourcesJar()
	sourceCompatibility = JavaVersion.VERSION_21
	targetCompatibility = JavaVersion.VERSION_21
}

jar {
	from("LICENSE") {
		rename { "${it}_${project.archives_base_name}" }
	}
}

splitEnvironmentSourceSets() tells Loom to separate client/main code so you're not mixing them accidentally.

modImplementation sourceSets.client.output lets your renderer/model classes be compiled and used properly.

sourceSets.client is configured to grab from src/client/java, just like you're using.

Version 21 compatibility is still there for Minecraft 1.21.5 (nice catch on your end).

Steps to Clean and Correct Your Mod Folder Structure

# Define the base directory of the mod
$modBaseDir = "C:\path\to\your\mod"  # Update to your mod directory

# Define the structure we need
$folders = @(
    "src\main\java\com\example\dave\entities",
    "src\main\resources\assets\mymodid\blockstates",
    "src\main\resources\assets\mymodid\lang",
    "src\main\resources\assets\mymodid\models",
    "src\main\resources\assets\mymodid\sounds",
    "src\main\resources\assets\mymodid\textures",
    "src\main\resources\assets\mymodid\item",
    "src\main\resources\data\mymodid",
    "src\main\resources\data\mymodid\loot_tables",
    "src\main\resources\data\mymodid\recipes"
)

# Create missing folders
foreach ($folder in $folders) {
    $folderPath = Join-Path $modBaseDir $folder
    if (-not (Test-Path -Path $folderPath)) {
        Write-Host "Creating folder: $folderPath"
        New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $folderPath
    }
}

# Create missing files (Java files)
$javaFiles = @(
    "src\main\java\com\example\dave\DAVE.java",
    "src\main\java\com\example\dave\entities\NPC.java"
)

foreach ($file in $javaFiles) {
    $filePath = Join-Path $modBaseDir $file
    if (-not (Test-Path -Path $filePath)) {
        Write-Host "Creating Java file: $filePath"
        New-Item -ItemType File -Path $filePath
    }
}

# Create missing files (JSON files)
$jsonFiles = @(
    "src\main\resources\assets\mymodid\blockstates\blockstate.json",
    "src\main\resources\assets\mymodid\lang\en_us.json",
    "src\main\resources\assets\mymodid\models\item\item_model.json",
    "src\main\resources\fabric.mod.json",
    "src\main\resources\pack.mcmeta"
)

foreach ($file in $jsonFiles) {
    $filePath = Join-Path $modBaseDir $file
    if (-not (Test-Path -Path $filePath)) {
        Write-Host "Creating JSON file: $filePath"
        New-Item -ItemType File -Path $filePath
    }
}

Write-Host "Folder and file structure cleaned and corrected!"

It creates basic .java and .json files that are typically used in a Fabric mod.

You can customize the paths ($modBaseDir) to your mod's specific directory.
